Incident.Summary: Disturbance at Wawa between Grandmother and Granddaughter.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: VIDEO/AUDIO RECORDINGS: Car B-35 // Body worn Camera available // In Car Camera not available // Car B-14 // ST Key #6165 // Body worn Camera available // In Car Camera not available // Car B-9 // TFC Sweckard #7221 // Body worn Camera available // In Car Camera not available // ATTACHMENTS: None SUSPECT: Tiffany Johnetta Minor (B/F DOB: 9/12/1979) VICTIM: Giselle Minor (B/F DOB: 11/11/2017) WITNESS/NEIGHBORHOOD CHECK: Ronnie Wayne Barrow (W/M DOB: 8/4/1977) Miracle Netz (B/F DOB: 3/14/2007) Krystel Lambert Wawa Night Shift Supervisor NARRATIVE: On 3/11/2023 at 2100 hours, I responded to Wawa, 5833 Ballenger Creek Pike Frederick, Maryland 21703. The complainant, Ronnie Wayne Barrow (W/M DOB: 8/4/1977), advised he was currently witnessing an older female strike and yell at her daughter. I made contact with Barrow via phone who advised he was parked at the the Wawa. Upon Troopers arrival, the suspect was identified the Tiffany Johnetta Minor (B/F DOB: 9/12/1979). Tiffany Minors granddaughter, Giselle Minor (B/F DOB: 11/11/2017), was inside of a maroon Honda Accord (MD Registration 8EG7225). Barrow advised he observed Tiffany Minor get out of her vehicle and walk around to the back door of her vehicle. He observed Tiffany open the door and partially enter the vehicle. Barrow advised he heard screaming coming from the vehicle and observed the vehicle shake back and forth. Barrow advised he did not observe what was going on inside of the vehicle due to the tinted window. Barrow then observed Tiffany Minor drag Giselle outside of the vehicle and into the Wawa. While Tiffany was walking inside of the Wawa with Giselle, Barrow advised she struck Giselle on the arm several times with a closed fist. Barrow advised there were two or three different outbursts where Tiffany struck Giselle. Tiffany Minor advised she picked Giselle up in Bowie and was driving to her residence in Clarksburg. Tiffany advised she drove over an hour to the Wawa in Frederick and asked Giselle if she had her (Tiffanys) cell phone. Giselle advised Tiffany that she did not have it. Tiffany became upset due to the possibility of having to drive back to Bowie to retrieve her cell phone. Tiffany used her other cell phone to track the location of the lost phone and realized it was at the Wawa. Tiffany searched her vehicle which revealed Giselle was hiding her cell phone under her car seat. Tiffany advised she then became upset and disciplined Giselle for lying to her by smacking her hand two or three times while walking into the Wawa. Tiffany advised she also verbally disciplined Giselle. Giselle did not have any visible injuries. TFC Sweckard spoke with Giselle and confirmed she was not hurt and verified the information given by Tiffany. Tiffany did not have any visible injuries on her hands. While walking into the Wawa, a witness got Troopers attention. The witness, Miracle Netz (B/F DOB: 3/14/2007), advised she observed part of the confrontation. Netz, who was in the vehicle with her mother, described the situation and claimed Tiffany dragged Giselle out of the vehicle and all the way into the Wawa. The manager of Wawa, Krystel Lambert, advised Tiffany and Giselle were inside of the Wawa prior to police arrival. Lambert advised Tiffany was verbally disciplining Giselle while inside of the Wawa. Lambert overheard Tiffany mentioning something about a cell phone. Lambert was able to access surveillance of the parking lot where the incident occurred. Troopers viewed the footage and did not observe any signs of abuse. Tiffany Minor was provided the case number and advised the incident would be documented, although there was no crime committed. All events occurred in Frederick County, Maryland. CASE STATUS: Closed, non-criminal.
